title: Commending Reverend Earl Jones, Sr. upon the occasion of his 25th Pastoral Anniversary
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION  commending  Reverend  Earl  Jones, Sr. upon the
occasion of his 25th Pastoral Anniversary

WHEREAS, The character and richness of religious and community  life  in
this  noble Empire State is nourished and fulfilled through the faithful
concern and selfless devotion of those who would commit  their  energies
and purpose to the ministry of others; and
  WHEREAS, It is the sense of this Legislative Body to bring full recog-
nition  and just tribute to those individuals who distinguish themselves
and the ministry through their unremitting commitment and preeminence of
service; and
  WHEREAS, This Legislative Body is justly  proud  to  commend  Reverend
Earl Jones, Sr. upon the occasion of his 25th Pastoral Anniversary; and
  WHEREAS, Reverend Earl Jones, Sr. has brought to his ministry an over-
whelming  spirit  of  charity  and  compassion,  acting  from vision and
enlightenment in conducting his  administrative  and  spiritual  duties,
while  always  displaying  the highest standards of personal and profes-
sional integrity and dedication; and
  WHEREAS, Born in Brooklyn, New York, Earl Jones graduated from  Frank-
lin  K. Lane High School in June of 1971; he later attended SUNY Potsdam
where he received a Bachelor's degree in Political Science and  History;
his postgraduate study was in the Master of Divinity Program of New York
Theological Seminary from 1987-1989; and
  WHEREAS,  Reverend  Jones  preached his trial sermon in March of 1981;
Dr. John H. Nichols and the First Calvary Baptist Church called Reverend
Jones to be assistant pastor; in addition, he served as  interim  pastor
for  a  year  and  was later called to the pastorate of First Calvary in
June of 1985; and
  WHEREAS, Ably led by Reverend Earl Jones, Sr., First  Calvary  Baptist
Church continues to prosper today and into the future; and
  WHEREAS, This distinguished man of God has always given enlightenment,
guidance  and  wisdom to the many entrusted to his care and has adminis-
tered abundantly and unstintingly to the spiritual and corporal needs of
all; and
  WHEREAS, With him throughout have been  his  wife,  Joyce,  and  their
children  Angela, Earl Jr., William, and two grandsons, all of whom feel
privileged to be a part of his life and rejoice in his achievements; and
  WHEREAS, It is the sense of this Legislative Body that when  a  person
of  such  noble aims and accomplishments is brought to our attention, it
is appropriate to publicly and  jubilantly  proclaim  and  commend  that
individual for the edification of others; now, therefore, be it
  RESOLVED,  That  this  Legislative  Body pause in its deliberations to
commend Reverend Earl Jones, Sr. upon the occasion of his 25th  Pastoral
Anniversary,  noting  his  unremitting  and  compassionate faith and his
exemplary service to God, man, and his community, and extending  to  him
the  heartfelt  best  wishes  of  this  Legislative Body for a future of
purposeful success and well-being; and be it further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to Reverend Earl Jones, Sr.
